intro: Alsine mutabilis, commonly known as the variable alsike, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Alsine mutabilis is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
